item.description:
Bank Verification Number (BVN) is the national ID system created by Nigerian banks to uniquely identified bank customers in the Nigerian banking ecosystem.

The banking ecosystem has also created a mechanism where all the bank accounts tied to a specific BVN could be gotten.

exec: pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status code (200)",()=>{
pm.test("Validation for the expected response message", ()=>{
pm.test("Confirm the masked contact field ('data') is present, is a non-empty string, and masked", ()=>{
pm.test("Ensure the meta properties (cost and balance) are present, are numbers, and contain valid values", ()=>{
// Cost is typically 0 for an OTP initiation step if the charge occurs upon final verification.
// Balance must be greater than 0 for the API to be operational.

item.name: Direct Debit ðŸ‡³ðŸ‡¬

exec: pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status codes",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the data property exists and report structure is an array", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm unique ID and name are present and correctly typed.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirms the bank_code is a string containing 3 digits).", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm that the NIBSS institution code is a 6-digit string.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the logo field is present as a string and looks like a valid URL.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the amount is returned as a string with two decimal places (e.g., \"50.00\").", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the API honored the limit parameter passed in the request (Query Params).", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the count in the metadata matches the number of bank objects actually returned in the array.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the API honored the page parameter.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm a nominal cost was applied, even for retrieving a configuration list.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the balance is returned as a number and has been updated", ()=>{
pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status codes",()=>{
pm.test("confirms the system-level status confirms success.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the bank details payload is present and is a JSON object.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm code format (usually 3 digits for commercial banks).", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the NIBSS code is a 6-digit string.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm he URL is present, is a string, and points to an image file.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the exact amount required to activate a mandate is correct and in the expected string/decimal format.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm meta field is present as a string (it's a stringified JSON object).", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm to ensure the necessary keys for direct debit are present within the stringified meta data.", ()=>{
console.log(". Meta Data Validation (Cost and Balance)")
pm.test("confirm to the low, expected cost for a configuration lookup.", ()=>{
pm.test("confirm the balance is returned as a number and has been updated.", ()=>{

item.description:
Direct debit is a payment method that allows an account holder to grant authorization for a biller or lender to take money from their bank account for services as of when due

this is the API

item.name: Mandates

exec: pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status codes",()=>{
pm.test("confirm a unique ID was generated and is valid.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm that the key terms of the mandate were stored exactly as sent.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm mandate start in the 'initiated' state",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the type was correctly recorded.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the type was correctly recorded.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the system generated a unique external tracking reference.",()=>{
pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status codes",()=>{
pm.test("confirm Mandates must be returned as an array nested under data.data.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the number of returned mandates does not exceed the requested limit (10).",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the total count in metadata must match the number of records returned in the current array.",()=>{
console.log("Deep Mandate Object Schema and Status Validation")
pm.test("confirm the unique ID and the external reference number are present and valid.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm all monetary fields are strings formatted with two decimal places.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the status is one of the allowed operational states.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the business logic fields are restricted to valid options.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the start_date adheres to the expected ISO 8601 format.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the nested bank name information is present ",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the nested beneficiary account details are present for auditing.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the instruction field is present, providing guidance on the current status.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm a nominal transaction cost was applied.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm he balance is returned as a number and has been updated.",()=>{

item.description: This endpoint allows you to create a mandate on a customer's account. The default mandate type is the emandate, which customers can easily activate by themselves.

exec: pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status codes",()=>{
pm.test("confirm Transactions must be returned as an array nested under data.data.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the number of returned transactions does not exceed the requested limit.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the 'page_size' in metadata matches the requested 'limit'",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the 'page' number in metadata matches the requested 'page'",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the 'records' count matches the number of transactions returned in the array.",()=>{
console.log("Deep Transaction Object Schema and Status Validation (Checking the first transaction)")
pm.test("confirm the transaction has a unique ID (number > 0)",()=>{
pm.test("confirm 'amount' is a string matching non-decimal format.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm 'status' is one of the allowed operational states (e.g., successful, failed, pending).",()=>{
pm.test("confirm 'reference' is present and is a string.",()=>{
pm.test("No transactions returned in the array.", () => {
console.warn("Array is empty. Skipping deep schema validation.");
console.log("Root Meta Data Validation (Cost and Balance)")
pm.test("confirm the cost for transaction lookup is present and a number (Expected: 1).",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the balance is returned as a number.",()=>{
pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status code (200)",()=>{
// CRITICAL: This test ensures the array exists and contains exactly one record.
pm.test("confirm the single transaction is returned inside a 'data' array and has length 1.",()=>{
console.log("Pagination/Meta Data Validation (Confirms single record retrieved)")
pm.test("confirm 'records' count matches the single transaction returned (1).",()=>{
// From here on, we access transactions[0]. If the previous test failed, the entire test run
// will be stopped or marked as failed, achieving the required "fail" state.
pm.test("confirm the returned 'reference' is present and is a string.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm 'amount' is a string formatted with two decimal places.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm 'status' is one of the operational states (successful, failed, pending).",()=>{
pm.test("confirm 'mandate_bvn' is present and has length 11.",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the mandate bank is Guaranty Trust Bank (GTB) for this sample.",()=>{
console.log("Root Meta Data Validation (Cost and Balance)")
pm.test("confirm the cost for transaction lookup is present and a number (Expected: 1).",()=>{
pm.test("confirm the balance is returned as a number.",()=>{
pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status codes",()=>{
pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status codes",()=>{
pm.test("Validation for the HTTP status codes",()=>{
